excerpts.text:
Librarians are a troop of kangaroos,
carrying our youngest into the future.
Our children are the librarians,
the volunteers and borrowers of books,
the custodians of our future libraries.
The key is catching babies' imaginations.
We're going on a library hunt. Hold on tight.

Librarians are a family of otters,
welcoming us through their doors.
A library is, and always will be
multigenerational, multicultural.
Bienvenue, witamy, marhaba.

Librarians are a movement of moles,
buried deep in archives.
Sometimes they have their noses
in a book, peeping out of the dark.
You know what a mole is like
when it emerges into the light.

Librarians are not dinosaurs,
they are nothing like a terror of T-Rexes.
But they help to keep the bones
of our dinosaurs safe, preserving histories.
Walking with librarians into the future,
we keep our past safe.
